meta.name: Sirate Tsion (The Order of Zion)
meta.description: The first book of the Ethiopic New Testament Church Order, detailing the statutes of the Apostolic community.

verses.text: This is the order of the Church of Zion, the mother of all churches, as delivered by the Apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Let the house of God be holy, and let no man enter it with a divided heart or with malice toward his brother.
The Bishop shall be the head, representing Christ; and the Priests shall be as the Apostles; and the Deacons as the angels who serve the throne.

chapters.name: On the Ordination of the Clergy

verses.text: When a man is to be made a Priest, let the Bishop lay hands upon him in the presence of the congregation, and let all the people say: 'He is worthy.'
He shall be taught the mysteries of the Law and the Gospel, and he shall be a man who ruleth his own house with gravity and peace.
The bread of the offering shall be made by clean hands, and the wine shall be of the fruit of the vine, unmixed with any defilement.
Let the Deacons guard the doors that no unbeliever may enter, and let the faithful stand in silence during the prayer of the Anaphora.
The Deacon shall be the voice of the Bishop and the servant of the poor; he shall seek out those who are in affliction and report their needs.
He shall not be a lover of gain, nor a speaker of double words, but a pillar of truth in the house of the Lord.

chapters.name: On the Service of the Widows

verses.text: Let the widows be chosen who have lived a life of prayer and fasting, and let them be sustained by the charity of the faithful.
They shall pray for the peace of the world and for the stability of the Church, for their prayers are as incense before the Father.
When the sun rises, let the faithful gather for the morning prayer; and at the time of the evening, let them return to give thanks for the day.
Let no man forsake the assembly on the Sabbath or on the Lordâ€™s Day, for these are the days of rest and resurrection.
If any man contend with his neighbor, let him not approach the altar until he be reconciled.
For God is love, and he who dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.
These are the laws of Zion, established for the order of the saints. Keep them, and you shall find life in the kingdom of heaven.
Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
